data.text:
Bruce Willis‚Äô wife, Emma Heming-Willis has shared that she has been in tears over the Christmas period as she struggles to deal with Bruce‚Äôs tragic illness.

Emma took to Instagram to share a series of photos celebrating the couples‚Äô 16 years together. She wrote that she had a ‚Äúgood cry‚Äù and revealed that although things have been tough for a while, her emotions have been amplified over the holidays.

‚ÄúYou know, holidays are hard, anniversaries are hard. But for me, this year, it has really been about community, building a community and connection,‚Äù she wrote.

‚ÄúAnd I just want to say that has been my lifeline and I just want to thank you for that.‚Äù

Earlier this month, Bruce Willis‚Äô family shared a devastating statement after discovering a development in his health battle. The family took to Instagram to share the news that his condition has ‚Äúprogressed.‚Äù

The family is ‚Äúnot sure how much time he has left‚Äù‚Ä¶ it is understood that the actors health has significantly deteriorated.

In an interview with Us Weekly a source close to the family shared that Bruce is having ‚Äúmore bad days than good.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo one knows how much time Bruce has left, so they‚Äôre soaking up every moment they get with him.‚Äù

The wife of beloved Hollywood actor, Bruce Willis, has spoken candidly about her husband‚Äôs health in a candid new personal essay for Maria Shriver‚Äôs Sunday Paper.

Since his diagnosis, Emma Heming Willis, who married Bruce in 2009, has been a caregiver for her husband, something she says she feels a level of ‚Äúguilt‚Äù about.

‚ÄúI struggle with guilt, knowing I have resources that others don‚Äôt. When I‚Äôm able to get out for a hike to clear my head, it‚Äôs not lost on me that not all care partners can do that,‚Äù she wrote.

‚ÄúWhen what I share about our family‚Äôs journey gets press attention, I know that there are thousands of untold, unheard stories, each of them deserving of compassion and concern.‚Äù

‚ÄúAt the same time, I see that what I share matters to others who may be struggling, and in a small way makes them feel seen and understood.‚Äù

She added that by going public with Bruce‚Äôs dementia diagnosis, she hoped in some ‚Äúsmall way‚Äù, families experiencing the same thing would feel ‚Äúseen and understood.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want people to know that when I hear from another family affected by FTD, I hear our family‚Äôs same story of grief, loss, and immense sadness echoed in theirs. It‚Äôs important to be an advocate on behalf of those families who don‚Äôt have the time, energy, or resources to advocate for themselves.‚Äù

The FTD Emma is referring to is frontotemporal dementia, a rare and progressive form of dementia that can cause extreme changes in behaviour and personality as well as declining cognition.

In 2022, the 68-year-old actor was diagnosed with aphasia which impacts how a person communicates, especially their speech. This then progressed into FTD, the Willis family confirming the sad news in February 2023.

The update from Emma comes mere weeks after the youngest daughter of Bruce and his ex-wife Demi Moore, Tallulah, gave another sad update about her father‚Äôs deteriorating health.

Reflecting upon the ‚Äúreally aggressive cognitive disease‚Äù that her father was fighting on The Drew Barrymore Show, Tallulah, 29, said that her blended family chose to go public about the battle Bruce was facing for several reasons.

‚ÄúOn one hand, it‚Äôs who we are as a family,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúBut also, it‚Äôs really important for us to spread awareness about FTD because there‚Äôs not enough information out there.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf we can take something that we‚Äôre struggling with as a family and individually and help other people turn it around, to make something beautiful about it, that‚Äôs really special for us.‚Äù

When asked about how her father was currently, Tallulah replied: ‚ÄúHe is the same, which I think, in this regard I‚Äôve learned is the best thing you can ask for. I see love when I‚Äôm with him, and it‚Äôs my dad and he loves me.‚Äù

Tallulah‚Äôs comments come shortly after a close friend of Bruce‚Äôs ‚Äì Glenn Gordon Caron ‚Äì provided a sad update on his close friend and collaborator‚Äôs deteriorating health.

Speaking with The New York Post, Glenn revealed that he had actively tried to remain in Bruce‚Äôs life in a private manner.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not always quite that good but I try and I do talk to him and his wife and I have a casual relationship with his three older children.‚Äù

He then elaborated on just how Bruce had deteriorated, explaining that the award-winning actor was ‚Äúnot totally verbal‚Äù and was ‚Äúseeing life through a screen door.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe thing that makes [his disease] so mind-blowing is [that] if you‚Äôve ever spent time with Bruce Willis, there is no one who had any more joie de vivre than he. He loved life and‚Ä¶.just adored waking up every morning and trying to live life to its fullest.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre with him you know that he‚Äôs Bruce and you‚Äôre grateful that he‚Äôs there,‚Äù he continued before making the heartbreaking admission that the ‚Äújoie de vivre‚Äù in Bruce was gone.

A month prior, Bruce‚Äôs loving wife Emma revealed to US breakfast television program Today it was ‚Äúhard to know‚Äù if her husband of almost 15 years was aware of his dementia diagnosis.

‚ÄúIt was a blessing and a curse to finally understand what was happening to him so can be into the acceptance of what it is,‚Äù the 45-year-old shared.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt make it any less painful, but just being in the know of what is happening to Bruce makes it a little easier.‚Äù

Frontotemporal dementia can be difficult to diagnose given the symptoms are often similar to a variety of other health conditions.

Medical professionals are also unsure what causes the condition but believe that it can be passed on genetically in roughly 20 ‚Äì 25% of people.

When his condition was first made public, his family released a heartfelt statement about the ‚Äúcruel‚Äù nature of the disease.

‚Äú[Frontotemporal dementia] is a cruel disease that many of us have never heard of and can strike anyone. Today there are no treatments for the disease, a reality that we hope can change in the years ahead,‚Äù the statement said.

‚ÄúAs Bruce‚Äôs condition advances, we hope that any media attention can be focused on shining a light on this disease that needs far more awareness and research.‚Äù

Reflecting upon how her family dynamic had shifted following Bruce‚Äôs declining health, his wife also revealed to Today that her husband was ‚Äúthe gift that keeps on giving.‚Äù

‚ÄúLove, patience, resilience. So much that he‚Äôs teaching me,‚Äù Emma said.

‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs teaching (our kids) so much. How to care, how to love. It‚Äôs a beautiful thing amongst the sadness.‚Äù

The mother of two also revealed that their daughters Mabel Ray, 11, and Evelyn Penn, 9 were ‚Äúaware‚Äù of their father‚Äôs health and the family home was ‚Äúvery honest and open.‚Äù

‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt want there to be any stigma or shame for their dad‚Äôs diagnosis or any form of dementia,‚Äù she added, noting how her husband‚Äôs condition had impacted their young girls.

Currently, Emma is a caregiver for her husband, sharing a home in Los Angeles with their two daughters.

Bruce‚Äôs ex-wife Demi Moore and their now adult daughters Rumer, Scout, and Tallulah have also been on hand to provide their support, the blended family even celebrating Bruce‚Äôs 68th birthday together in March 2023.

It‚Äôs an unconventional arrangement but is one borne out of love.

The blended family even celebrated Thanksgiving together in November 2023, Emma taking to her Instagram to share a sweet snap of them all together.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm grateful and thankful to know this kind of love ü§çüß°,‚Äù she captioned the post.
